data.label:
LineNo: 10443768,

Narrator: You opened your eyes to this realm.
en


You opened your eyes to this realm.\n\nBecoming a king was never your choice.

LineNo: 10443774,

Narrator: You opened your eyes to this realm.
Menu Text en


1905|Monqiz|Kingdom of Rizia

LineNo: 10443876,

Player_Romus: ...quickly became close friends.
en


...quickly became close friends.

LineNo: 10443978,

Player_Romus: ...enjoyed bossing him around.
en


...enjoyed bossing him around.

LineNo: 10444080,

Narrator: Your region came to see you as a cr...
en


Your region came to see you as a cruel but capable leader.\n\nOne day, the king came for an unannounced visit. He brought with him a pale-skinned young woman with striking blue eyes.\n\nHesitantly, she introduced herself as Lena Livingston -- the sister of Queen Beatrice of Rumburg, and your wife-to-be.

LineNo: 10444086,

Narrator: Your region came to see you as a cr...
Menu Text en


1930|June 20|Monqiz

LineNo: 10444188,

Player_Romus: You bowed.
en


You bowed.

LineNo: 10444290,

Player_Romus: You demanded to know what was going...
en


You demanded to know what was going on.

LineNo: 10444392,

Narrator: King Valero told you that he had no...
en


King Valero told you that he had no choice. \n\nWith Wehlen descending into civil war, Rizia needed a new ally.\n\nA partnership with the Kingdom of Rumburg, cemented with an arranged marriage, was in the best interest of both monarchies.\n\nBesides, he added, you would surely grow to love her.

LineNo: 10444502,

Player_Romus: He was right.
en


He was right.

LineNo: 10444604,

Player_Romus: He was wrong.
en


He was wrong.

LineNo: 10444706,

Narrator: You and Lena went on a few dates, b...
en


You and Lena went on a few dates, but neither of you felt a spark. By the time you lifted her veil, you knew the marriage was a sham.\n\nFor your countries' sake, you slept together a few times. One of those resulted in the birth of your daughter, Vina. \n\nAfter she was born, you...

LineNo: 10444712,

Narrator: You and Lena went on a few dates, b...
Menu Text en


1932|March 1|A Family Man

LineNo: 10444830,

Narrator: The uprising had other consequences...
en


The uprising had other consequences.\n\nThe traitor Lucas Sazon was executed, and his pregnant wife sent into exile. As further punishment, Iza -- the capital city of Brenas, and the Sazons' ancestral home -- was handed over to your family.\n\nYour uncle Hugo was sent to serve as its steward. And you were to take his place as reigning Duke of Valenqiris.\n\nAt your childhood home in Monqiz, you...

LineNo: 10444836,

Narrator: The uprising had other consequences...
Menu Text en


1927|Porte Drazon|A Changed Country

LineNo: 10444938,

Player_Romus: ...focused on finding and punishing...
en


...focused on finding and punishing the remaining traitors to the throne.

LineNo: 10445040,

Player_Romus: ...largely ignored your duties and...
en


...largely ignored your duties and lived a life of leisure.

LineNo: 10445142,

Player_Romus: ...did your best to help your regio...
en


...did your best to help your region rebuild.

LineNo: 10445244,

Narrator: You and Lena began having hours-lon...
en


You and Lena began having hours-long conversations about your royal upbringings, hopes and dreams.\n\nBy the time you lifted her veil, you knew it was true love.\n\nThe years after your wedding and the birth of your daughter Vina were the happiest of your life. \n\nThe only trouble was...

LineNo: 10445250,

Narrator: You and Lena began having hours-lon...
Menu Text en


1932|March 1|A Family Man

LineNo: 10445368,

Player_Romus: But it was too late.
en


But it was too late.

LineNo: 10445470,

Narrator: You were devastated. After the f...
en


You were devastated.\n\nAfter the funeral, your mother Estela came to visit and found you hardly able to function. She promptly moved in to help out with Vina. \n\nHugo suggested you turn to Wruhecism, Rizia's official religion, to cope with your loss.

LineNo: 10445580,

Player_Romus: If anything, you became less of a b...
en


If anything, you became less of a believer.

LineNo: 10445682,

Narrator: You mourned for a while. But you...
en


You mourned for a while.\n\nBut you also had a province to lead and a young daughter to care for. Your mother Estela moved in to help out with Vina. \n\nHugo suggested you turn to Wruhecism, Rizia's official religion, to cope with your loss.

LineNo: 10445792,

Narrator: Meanwhile, the situation in the cap...
en


Meanwhile, the situation in the capital worsened.\n\nRizian nationalists continued to protest the loss of Zille and the country's increasing diversity. Rumors spread that an anti-monarchist movement was beginning to grow once more.\n\nYour father called Hugo back to the capital to keep an eye on his council.

LineNo: 10445798,

Narrator: Meanwhile, the situation in the cap...
Menu Text en


1946|August|Porte Drazon

LineNo: 10445900,

Player_Romus: You reasoned the King had brought h...
en


You reasoned the King had brought his troubles on himself.

LineNo: 10446002,

Narrator: Outsiders also took notice of the k...
en


Outsiders also took notice of the king's decline.\n\nOne of them was Axel Reinhart, the new ruler of the Grand Duchy of Pales.\n\nHe sent you an invitation to visit him, on two conditions: You were to go alone, and without your father's knowledge.

LineNo: 10446008,

Narrator: Outsiders also took notice of the k...
Menu Text en


1948|October|Porte Drazon

LineNo: 10446118,

Player_Romus: You accepted.
en


You accepted.

LineNo: 10446220,

Narrator: It was your first time in Pales sin...
en


It was your first time in Pales since childhood. You were surprised at how modern everything seemed now.\n\nDuke Reinhart welcomed you to his palace. He said he was hoping to re-establish relations with Rizia once you became king.\n\nYou...

LineNo: 10446226,

Narrator: It was your first time in Pales sin...
Menu Text en


1948|October 5|Pales|Confrontations

LineNo: 10446352,

Player_Romus: ...told him that would only be poss...
en


...told him that would only be possible once Pales rejoined Rizia, where it belonged.

LineNo: 10446454,

Player_Romus: ...said you were looking forward to...
en


...said you were looking forward to putting the past behind you.

LineNo: 10446556,

Player_Romus: ...agreed that a thaw between Rizia...
en


...agreed that a thaw between Rizia and Pales could be lucrative on both sides.

LineNo: 10446658,

Narrator: The duke was taken aback and ordere...
en


The duke was taken aback and ordered you to leave at once.\n\nAfterwards, you...

LineNo: 10446768,

Narrator: The duke was satisfied with your an...
en


The duke was satisfied with your answer. You spent the next few days getting to know him and the duchy better.\n\nAfterwards, you...

LineNo: 10446870,

Narrator: He'd gone straight to bed after din...
en


He'd gone straight to bed after dinner. When your mother went to check in on him later, she found him comatose in the bedroom.\n\nThe doctors suspected a heart attack.

LineNo: 10446980,

Player_Romus: You rushed to see him.
en


You rushed to see him.

LineNo: 10447082,

Player_Romus: You stayed where you were.
en


You stayed where you were.

LineNo: 10447184,

Narrator: Your father looked pale as a ghost....
en


Your father looked pale as a ghost. It took all his effort to speak.\n\nIn a hoarse whisper, he warned you not to follow in his footsteps.\n\nYour reign would be a fresh start for House Toras. A new chance to take back the lands that were lost.

LineNo: 10447190,

Narrator: Your father looked pale as a ghost....
Menu Text en


1949|November 18|Porte Drazon

LineNo: 10447292,

Narrator: The next day, King Valero Toras was...
en


The next day, King Valero Toras was no more.\n\nYou and Vina traveled to Porte Drazon to comfort your mother.\n\nShe handed you a note your father had written you.

LineNo: 10447298,

Narrator: The next day, King Valero Toras was...
Menu Text en


1949|November 18|Porte Drazon

LineNo: 10447400,

Player_Romus: He closed his eyes.
en


He closed his eyes.

LineNo: 10447502,

Player_Romus: His last words.
en


His last words.

LineNo: 10447604,

Narrator: In the letter, he warned you not to...
en


In the letter, he warned you not to follow in his footsteps.\n\nYour reign would be a fresh start for House Toras. A new chance to take back the lands that were lost.

LineNo: 10447714,

Narrator: Only after his funeral, gathered at...
en


Only after his funeral, gathered at the palace with your mother and daughter, did the realization begin to dawn on you.\n\nFrom the day you were born, your entire life had been leading to this moment.

LineNo: 10447816,

Player_Romus: You fought back tears.
en


You fought back tears.

LineNo: 10447918,

Player_Romus: Now, it was finally here.
en


Now, it was finally here.

LineNo: 10448020,

Player_Romus: You threw it away.
en


You threw it away.

LineNo: 10448122,

Player_Romus: It was your birthright.
en


It was your birthright.

LineNo: 10448224,

Player_Romus: It was your burden.
en


It was your burden.

LineNo: 10448326,

Player_Romus: It was your calling.
en


It was your calling.

LineNo: 10448428,

Narrator: From a young age, you knew you were...
en


From a young age, you knew you were no ordinary child. \n\nYou were Romus Toras. Grandson of Queen Lyza, ruler of all of Rizia. Son of Crown Prince Valero, the Duke of Valenqiris.\n\nFor most of the year, you lived with your father Valero and your mother Estela in a lavish palace atop the cliffs of Monqiz. Each summer, though, you...

LineNo: 10448536,

Player_Romus: ...visited your mother's common-bor...
en


...visited your mother's common-born family at their home by the Zille harbor.

LineNo: 10448638,

Player_Romus: ...stayed with the Queen at the roy...
en


...stayed with the Queen at the royal residence in Porte Drazon.

LineNo: 10448740,

Player_Romus: ...went hunting with your father's...
en


...went hunting with your father's brother Hugo in the forests of Brenas.

LineNo: 10448842,

Narrator: Your uncle taught you more than jus...
en


Your uncle taught you more than just how to hold and aim a gun. \n\nYou learned the value of staying patient and keeping your eyes and ears open at all times.

LineNo: 10448958,

Narrator: You were fascinated by the splendor...
en


You were fascinated by the splendor of your surroundings and the intricacies of your grandmother's court.

LineNo: 10449068,

Narrator: Your grandparents were fisherpeople...
en


Your grandparents were fisherpeople of modest means, and staying with them helped you feel grounded.

LineNo: 10449178,

Narrator: When Queen Lyza died, the whole cou...
en


When Queen Lyza died, the whole country grieved.\n\nBut the mourning could only last for so long.

LineNo: 10449184,

Narrator: When Queen Lyza died, the whole cou...
Menu Text en


1918|January 28|Porte Drazon|A New King

LineNo: 10449286,

Player_Romus: ...asked him about the rumors.
en


...asked him about the rumors.

LineNo: 10449388,

Player_Romus: ...didn't mention either.
en


...didn't mention either.

LineNo: 10449490,

Narrator: Your father laughed and told you ce...
en


Your father laughed and told you certain other royals had never approved of him marrying a commoner.\n\nBut he and Estela were in love. And love conquered all.

LineNo: 10449600,

Narrator: Your father laughed and told you th...
en


Your father laughed and told you that some people had come to believe Rizia shouldn't be ruled by a monarch anymore.\n\nBut of course, he assured you, they were wrong.

LineNo: 10449710,

Player_Romus: You had your doubts.
en


You had your doubts.

LineNo: 10449812,

Narrator: Life in Porte Drazon was less excit...
en


Life in Porte Drazon was less exciting than you expected. You were tutored privately and rarely had contact with non-royals.\n\nAt the palace, the closest person to your age was Pabel, the groundskeeper's son -- a quiet but friendly kid who knew about every plant in the palace gardens. You...

LineNo: 10449818,

Narrator: Life in Porte Drazon was less excit...
Menu Text en


1920

LineNo: 10449920,

Player_Romus: ...didn't have much to do with each...
en


...didn't have much to do with each other.

LineNo: 10450022,

Narrator: When you came of age, your father i...
en


When you came of age, your father invited you to start sitting in on royal council meetings. You decided...

LineNo: 10450028,

Narrator: When you came of age, your father i...
Menu Text en


1923|September

LineNo: 10450130,

Player_Romus: ...that you would love to join.
en


...that you would love to join.

LineNo: 10450232,

Player_Romus: ...to go to university instead.
en


...to go to university instead.

LineNo: 10450334,

Player_Romus: ...to join the military instead.
en


...to join the military instead.

LineNo: 10450436,

Narrator: The council members took you under...
en


The council members took you under their wing, catching you up on the issues of the day.\n\nOne of their main concerns was Pales, a former part of Rizia that had long belonged to the Empire of Valgos.\n\nNow that the empire had fallen, war councillor General Taddeus Azaro was launching a military campaign to take the newly independent region back. You...

LineNo: 10450554,

Narrator: At the prestigious University of Iz...
en


At the prestigious University of Iza, you studied history, politics and economics to prepare for your eventual reign.\n\nIn one of your classes, an argument broke out about Pales, a former part of Rizia that had long belonged to the Empire of Valgos.\n\nNow that the empire had fallen, your father's government was launching a military campaign to take the newly independent region back. You...

LineNo: 10450672,

Player_Romus: Every autumn, you returned home a l...
en


Every autumn, you returned home a little wiser.

LineNo: 10451062,

Player_Romus: You believed him.
en


You believed him.

LineNo: 10451164,

Player_Romus: ...thought it was a lost cause.
en


...thought it was a lost cause.

LineNo: 10451266,

Player_Romus: ...agreed that it was time to recon...
en


...agreed that it was time to reconquer the territory.

LineNo: 10451368,

Player_Romus: ...didn't have an opinion either wa...
en


...didn't have an opinion either way.

LineNo: 10451470,

Narrator: At the prestigious Camp Domus acade...
en


At the prestigious Camp Domus academy in the mountains of Montaklar, you learned about war strategy and combat tactics.\n\nOne day, the royal war councillor, General Taddeus Azaro, came to visit. He announced a military campaign on Pales, a former part of Rizia that had long belonged to the Empire of Valgos.\n\nNow that the empire had fallen, he said, the time was right to take the region back. You...

LineNo: 10451588,

Narrator: As you continued to serve on the co...
en


As you continued to serve on the council, the campaign in Pales dragged on.\n\nIt seemed like an easy victory until your northern neighbor Lespia got involved, sending weapons and financial aid.\n\nProtests against the war sprouted up around the country. You...

LineNo: 10451594,

Narrator: As you continued to serve on the co...
Menu Text en


1925|War and Uncertainty

LineNo: 10452556,

Narrator: As you continued your studies, the...
en


As you continued your studies, the Pales campaign dragged on.\n\nIt seemed like an easy victory until your northern neighbor Lespia got involved, sending weapons and financial aid.\n\nProtests against the war sprouted up on campus. You...

LineNo: 10452562,

Narrator: As you continued your studies, the...
Menu Text en


1925|War and Uncertainty

LineNo: 10452680,

Narrator: You weren't allowed to fight on the...
en


You weren't allowed to fight on the ground, so you watched from General Azaro's headquarters as the Pales campaign dragged on.\n\nIt seemed like an easy victory until your northern neighbor Lespia got involved, sending weapons and financial aid.\n\nDissent began brewing among your fellow recruits. You...

LineNo: 10452686,

Narrator: You weren't allowed to fight on the...
Menu Text en


1925|War and Uncertainty

LineNo: 10452804,

Player_Romus: ...asked your father to stop the bl...
en


...asked your father to stop the bloodshed.

LineNo: 10452906,

Player_Romus: ...begged him to crack down on the...
en


...begged him to crack down on the traitors.

LineNo: 10453008,

Player_Romus: ...refrained from taking sides.
en


...refrained from taking sides.

LineNo: 10453110,

Narrator: Some troops were withdrawn, but the...
en


Some troops were withdrawn, but the fire had been lit.\n\nYour next council meeting was interrupted by the announcement that the navy had mutinied. Bloody clashes between pro- and anti-monarchists were erupting across the country.

LineNo: 10453116,

Narrator: Some troops were withdrawn, but the...
Menu Text en


1926|April 7|Porte Drazon

LineNo: 10454522,

Player_Romus: The Century of Revolutions had reac...
en


The Century of Revolutions had reached Rizia at last.

LineNo: 10454624,

Narrator: Some troops were withdrawn, but the...
en


Some troops were withdrawn, but the fire had been lit.\n\nThe next day, class was interrupted by the announcement that the navy had mutinied. Bloody clashes between pro- and anti-monarchists were erupting across the country.

LineNo: 10454630,

Narrator: Some troops were withdrawn, but the...

en


Some troops were withdrawn, but the fire had been lit.\n\nThe next day, General Azaro burst into headquarters with the news that the navy had mutinied. Bloody clashes between pro- and anti-monarchists were erupting across the country.

1926|April 7|Porte Drazon

LineNo: 10456044,

Narrator: The head of palace security insiste...
en


The head of palace security insisted you be driven to a safehouse outside of Porte Drazon.\n\nAs you left city limits, though, an unmarked car swerved in front of you, blocking the road.\n\nA trio of masked men with guns jumped out, quickly overpowered your guards and forced you out of the vehicle.

LineNo: 10456708,

Player_Romus: You tried to fight them.
en


You tried to fight them.

LineNo: 10456810,

Player_Romus: You complied with their demands.
en


You complied with their demands.

LineNo: 10456912,

Player_Romus: You tried to run away.
en


You tried to run away.

LineNo: 10457014,

Narrator: The king insisted you be driven bac...
en


The king insisted you be driven back to the capital immediately.\n\nAs you left Iza city limits, though, an unmarked car swerved in front of you, blocking the road.\n\nA trio of masked men with guns jumped out, quickly overpowered your guards and forced you out of the vehicle.

LineNo: 10457116,

Narrator: The king insisted you be driven bac...
en


The king insisted you be driven back to the capital immediately.\n\nAs you left Montaklar, though, an unmarked car swerved in front of you, blocking the road.\n\nA trio of masked men with guns jumped out, quickly overpowered your guards and forced you out of the vehicle.

LineNo: 10457218,

Player_Romus: You tried to fight them.
en


You tried to fight them.

LineNo: 10457320,

Narrator: Your military training kicked in an...
en


Your military training kicked in and you put up a serious struggle. They shot you in the shoulder before you were finally subdued.\n\nAs your consciousness faded, you recognized one of your captors' voices: Lucas Sazon, Duke of Brenas and the head of Rizia's third royal house.\n\nA hood went over your head.

LineNo: 10457422,

Narrator: You ran for your life. But before y...
en


You ran for your life. But before you could get far, you felt a sharp pain in your leg and collapsed.\n\nAs your captors caught up with you, you recognized one of their voices: Lucas Sazon, Duke of Brenas and the head of Rizia's third royal house.\n\nA hood went over your head.

LineNo: 10457524,

Narrator: You recognized one of their voices:...
en


You recognized one of their voices: Lucas Sazon, Duke of Brenas and the head of Rizia's third royal house.\n\nA hood went over your head.

LineNo: 10457626,

Narrator: Your captors subdued you after only...
en


Your captors subdued you after only the slightest struggle. \n\nYou recognized one of their voices: Lucas Sazon, Duke of Brenas and the head of Rizia's third royal house.\n\nA hood went over your head.

LineNo: 10457728,

Player_Romus: Then, darkness.
en


Then, darkness.

LineNo: 10457830,

Narrator: They held you captive for nearly a...
en


They held you captive for nearly a week.\n\nWhen rescue finally came, it was in the form of a man with a white, blue and magenta flag on his fatigues.

LineNo: 10457836,

Narrator: They held you captive for nearly a...
Menu Text en


1926|April 13

LineNo: 10458130,

Player_Romus: Wehlen's flag.
en


Wehlen's flag.

LineNo: 10458232,

Narrator: At the palace, you pieced together...
en


At the palace, you pieced together what had happened.\n\nIn desperation, your father had pleaded for the aid of a neighboring country, Wehlen, to neutralize the uprising.\n\nBut their help came at a price. An agreement signed by both countries transferred ownership of the port of Zille and its surrounding region to Wehlen for the next 25 years.

LineNo: 10458238,

Narrator: At the palace, you pieced together...
Menu Text en


1926|April 13|Porte Drazon

LineNo: 10458356,

Player_Romus: You wondered how King Valero could...
en


You wondered how King Valero could have been so stupid.

LineNo: 10458458,

Player_Romus: You thanked him for restoring order...
en


You thanked him for restoring order.

LineNo: 10458560,

Player_Romus: You were just happy to be alive.
en


You were just happy to be alive.

LineNo: 10458662,

Narrator: You were a constant newspaper fixtu...
en


You were a constant newspaper fixture. They called you the "Party Prince".\n\nOne day, the king came for an unannounced visit. He brought with him a pale-skinned young woman with striking blue eyes.\n\nHesitantly, she introduced herself as Lena Livingston -- the sister of Queen Beatrice of Rumburg, and your wife-to-be.

LineNo: 10458668,

Narrator: You were a constant newspaper fixtu...
Menu Text en

LineNo: 10458770,

en


Valenqiris came to see you as a generous, capable leader.\n\nOne day, the king came for an unannounced visit. He brought with him a pale-skinned young woman with striking blue eyes.\n\nHesitantly, she introduced herself as Lena Livingston -- the sister of Queen Beatrice of Rumburg, and your wife-to-be.

LineNo: 10458776,

Narrator: Valenqiris came to see you as a gen...
Menu Text en


1930|June 20|Monqiz

LineNo: 10458878,

Player_Romus: You kissed her hand.
en


You kissed her hand.

LineNo: 10459076,

Player_Romus: ...that your royal obligations some...
en


...that your royal obligations sometimes got in the way of being a good husband and father.

LineNo: 10459178,

Player_Romus: ...that being a husband and father...
en


...that being a husband and father distracted you from your royal obligations.

LineNo: 10459280,

Player_Romus: ...that you couldn't stop yourself...
en


...that you couldn't stop yourself from having the occasional affair.

LineNo: 10459382,

Player_Romus: ...tried your best to be a good fat...
en


...tried your best to be a good father.

LineNo: 10459484,

Player_Romus: ...ignored your family and threw yo...
en


...ignored your family and threw yourself into your work.

LineNo: 10459586,

Player_Romus: ...had a string of affairs.
en


...had a string of affairs.

LineNo: 10460010,

Narrator: Many of the foreigners ended up in...
en


Many of the foreigners ended up in the province of Brenas, where a nationalist movement called Su Omina began demanding that the King put Rizia "above all".\n\nAs Duke of Iza, your uncle Hugo turned a blind eye to Su Omina's activities, while his teenage son Ricardus became a vocal supporter.\n\nEventually, Ricardus -- better known as Rico -- approached you about speaking at one of the group's rallies.

en


You were putting your clothes back on when you got the call.\n\nThe weather had turned stormy in the middle of the Gulf of Valenqiris. When the captain tried to turn the boat around, it was hit by a breaking wave and cracked in half.\n\nThe Coast Guard managed to save Vina on time. But by the time they pulled your wife out, she was barely breathing.\n\nYou rushed to the hospital.
